title: What are the ethics of a big corporation like Amazon creating AI technology to help the police department? - Quora

response.answer_text: Amazon typically doesn’t start by creating a technology for others. What does happen though is that Amazon creates new technologies that it uses - then they make it available to others so they can use it, and Amazon can make additional revenue. I think what you are asking about is AI + facial recognition, and that is quite useful for a broad range of purposes. As for licensing them to the police, there isn’t any ethical problem at all. Ultimately, warrants are authorized by humans. The AI + facial recognition software is going to be far from perfect, but what it effectively does is no more unethical than using a search engine. Depending on what the parameters are, it will find matches and near matches. What follows that is 100% up to human decision. An ethical problem would arise if this AI + facial recognition were being used without any human authorization, and your computer system was issuing arrest warrants on its own. Otherwise, the ethical issue I see are those that complain about it using fallacious and deceptive reasoning for unethical purposes.
Hmm. Ethics. Using AI to make people safer, reduce crime, and arrest criminals? How is this even a question? Sign me up.
